title: Hydro-Transformer: Learning Streamflow Patterns Across River Networks
subtitle: Historical Streamflow Reconstruction with High-Confidence Gage Estimates
authors: T. Akinrele, J. James, R. Rahimi, A. Mittal
affiliations: The University of Alabama · Alabama Water Institute · CIROH

sections.title: Background
sections.body: Hydrologic prediction in ungauged basins is a central challenge. We leverage transformers to capture long-range dependencies across space and time while respecting upstream–downstream structure.
bullets: Targets: Daily streamflow; basins with and without gages

sections.title: Methods
sections.body: We construct upstream–downstream pairs and encode static attributes and dynamic forcings. The encoder models seasonal and event-scale context. The decoder predicts discharge.

sections.title: Results
sections.body: Transformers outperform LSTMs on median NSE, especially in snow-influenced regions.

sections.title: Conclusion
sections.body: Hydro-Transformer provides a promising path to robust predictions in ungauged basins and supports operational forecasting.
